medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began four months before admission with dysuria and dark urine, diagnosed as a urinary tract infection that did not respond to treatment. Ten days prior to admission, the patient experienced dark urine, pruritus, intermittent epigastric pain, weight loss of 5 kg over 3 months, lightening of stool color, and a small purple area on her right arm. No fever, chills, nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea were reported.
medical_history.family_history: Mother and three brothers died of cerebrovascular disease; a sister had a myocardial infarction at age 53; another brother died of liver cancer; father had asthma.
medical_history.social_history: Recent immigrant from the Dominican Republic one year prior; lives with family; does not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs.
